result.execSummary:
The defendant Jodi A Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jodi A Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jodi A Martin was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURT, ANY BOND FROM 16CM34 APPLIES ALSO.
Jail time stayed pending completion of inpatient treatment - report no later than April 8, 2016.

timeConds.notes: ** 9/20/16  Jail sentence stayed.  Stayed pending completion of inpatient treatment - report no later than April 8, 2016.    -****Effective 12/5/2016, Court vacates 90 days jail.***

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jodi A Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Jodi A Martin, appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:02)
State - here for review, sentenced on March 8 pending completion of AODA treatment - letter in file, has done some residential treatment but it didn't meet the requirements (letter filed in court) - don't have any new files - vacate the 90 days jail
Deft - have been doing well in program, relapses are further apart, involved in Church, have new people around her
Court addresses the deft

COURT:  vacates 90 days jail

Defendant, Jodi A Martin, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Hanna Neuberg - Clerk
(1:31)

State- 12 months prob - 90 days jail - inpatient treatment denied - did not report to serve 90 days jail - requesting court to impose 90 days jail - does not object to treatment

Bub - jail sent. should be stayed - release DE on bond and set for new sent hearing -


COURT - lift jail time stay balance of 90 days - court review for 90 days - 

  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Jodi A Martin, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Prosecuting attorney Kaley Walker.  Defendant in custody.   Hanna Neuberg - Clerk
(1:28pm)

State - requests to impose 90 day jail stay

Bub - agrues 


COURT - return tomorrow (Tuesday) - warrant quashed - Deft sitting on sentence  Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Sheriff's Affidavit in Support of Request to Revoke Huber Status of Sentenced Inmate

Defendant, Jodi A Martin with Attorney Evan Thomas Bins Nordgren appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:40)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Nordgren - have agreement - plea to 15CM542 Ct 1 - 12 mo prob 90 days jail stayed upon completion of inpatient treatment - $443 and $100 dom abuse surchg all other matters dismissed

Deft - 15CM542 Ct 1 - pleads guilty - waives rights & JT

COURT:  15CM542 Ct 1 - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 1 year probation
$243 cc
$200 dna surchg
$100 dom abuse surchg
***$100 CASH BOND APPLIES FROM 16CM34 - PAYMENT PLAN FOR BALANCE***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
90 days jail - stayed pending completion of inpatient treatment - report no later than April 8, 2016
No alcohol
Credit 1 day if revoked

DISMISS:  15CM542 Ct 2, 16CM34

Defendant, Jodi A Martin with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:25)
(11:59)  recalled
  Deft waives reading & speedy trial
        pleads not guilty
